official-title.#text: To amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate segments of the mainstem of the Nashua River and its tributaries in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts for study for potential addition to the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives June 23, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Nashua River Wild and Scenic River Study Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Nashua River Wild and Scenic River Study Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 5(a) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act

text.#text: The approximately 19-mile segment of the mainstem of the Nashua River from the confluence of the North and South Nashua Rivers in Lancaster, Massachusetts, north to the Massachusetts/New Hampshire State line, except the approximately 4.8-mile segment of the mainstem of the Nashua River from the Route 119 bridge in Groton, Massachusetts, downstream to its confluence with the Nissitissit River in Pepperell, Massachusetts.
The 10-mile segment of the Squannacook River from its headwaters at Ash Swamp downstream to its confluence with the Nashua River in Shirley/Ayer, Massachusetts.
The 3.5-mile segment of the Nissitissit River from the Massachusetts/New Hampshire State line downstream to its confluence with the Nashua River in Pepperell, Massachusetts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 5(b) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall complete the study of the Nashua River in Massachusetts and New Hampshire, as described in
, and submit a report describing the results of that study to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate.

text.#text: Not later than 3 years after the date on which funds are made available to carry out this paragraph, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Nashua River Wild and Scenic River Study Act/s:3

text.#text: include a discussion of the effect of the designation of the area to be studied under this Act under the
existing commercial and recreational activities, such as hunting, fishing, trapping, recreational shooting, motor boat use, or bridge construction;
the authorization, construction, operation, maintenance, or improvement of energy production and transmission infrastructure; and

Nashua River Wild and Scenic River Study Act/s:4/p:1/sp:B
